name: sfchronicle
text:
Quarterback C.J. Beathard, the 49ers’ king of lost causes, feels like there will still be nothing to lose when he starts in place of Nick Mullens, who is out with a season-ending elbow injury.
https://t.co/hWdkx1G0Mm

name: sfchronicle
text: “It’s just heartbreaking — every single day, there’s probably two to four break-ins a night,” said Mark Dietrich, a resident of the Richmond who is trying to raise community awareness about the issue. https://t.co/I8dKjbbHsu

name: sfchronicle
text:
With hospital ICUs almost out of space, counties including Santa Clara are demanding people not gather in groups for Christmas, and Gov. Gavin Newsom is warning of "a surge on top of a surge on top of a surge." Health reporter @erinallday has the story.
https://t.co/xHNgY8n9NQ

name: sfchronicle
text: The Bay Area’s average case rate has grown from 6.1 per 100,000 people in October to a staggering 41.1 in December so far. https://t.co/7kVpl99cZm

name: sfchronicle
text: Fire season is over in Northern California, but for many evacuees, especially the poor and vulnerable, the nightmare is only getting worse. https://t.co/NskD2EZmBK

name: sfchronicle
text: Los Angeles officials have been forced to redraw their charts forecasting hospitalizations. Will things get this bad here in the Bay Area? https://t.co/1lifsgf8Oz https://t.co/u3uhy5rbBt

name: sfchronicle
text: “We’re not just a bunch of wealthy homeowners trying to secure our garages and protect our expensive bikes,” said Mark Dietrich. “Some of our neighbors have had homes here for generations. They’re vulnerable, and they’re being targeted as well.” https://t.co/UKOdUroNRZ

name: sfchronicle
text:
S.F. resident, facing holidays without job or health insurance, feels pandemic’s economic toll.

Story by @NanetteAsimov: https://t.co/1vRfEWXRw5

name: sfchronicle
text:
A car crashes into a side entrance of the War Memorial Opera House, leaving the driver in serious condition and causing minor damage to the building.

Story by @NMishanec: https://t.co/C9nsn11xJv

name: sfchronicle
text: Can the Bay Area get as bad as Los Angeles given the current trajectory? https://t.co/6rFhfqyyte

name: sfchronicle
text: Reports of break-ins rose throughout San Francisco this year. But some of the biggest spikes were in two neighborhoods — areas where garages housing bicycles, scooters and sporting equipment act as a beacon for thieves. https://t.co/Yoz2tnhAjj

name: sfchronicle
text: Amid a rash of burglaries this year — brazen, sometimes shockingly crafty invasions — San Francisco residents are adopting a siege mentality. https://t.co/JP7ylK3Hna

name: sfchronicle
text: Contra Costa County reports more than 400 new cases: Public health officials reported 439 new coronavirus cases on Thursday, marking the eleventh day in a row Contra Costa County officials reported more than 400 new cases a day. https://t.co/QOD3DU6IXA

name: sfchronicle
text:
BREAKING: Police are investigating a stabbing in San Jose on Thursday night, officials said. 
Story by @ByLHernandez: https://t.co/gz9PmXKfEo https://t.co/1a9etNfMxx

name: sfchronicle
text: @ByLHernandez UPDATE: One man was stabbed and taken to a local hospital for treatment in San Jose Thursday night, police said. https://t.co/i1ufgm2plc

name: sfchronicle
text: @ByLHernandez San Jose police officers responded to a report of stabbing on the 3000 Block of Southside Drive and found a man with at least one stab wound, San Jose police spokesperson Officer Steve Aponte told The Chronicle. https://t.co/i1ufgm2plc

name: sfchronicle
text: President Trump is expected to sign a new order requiring people flying from the UK into the U.S. to test negative for the coronavirus “no more than 72 hours before departure,” U.S. Department of Health and Human Services officials said Thursday. https://t.co/GpT39B9yWa

name: sfchronicle
text: Black Christmas decorations remind me, and other Black folks, of home, of a happy Black household, writes @JustMrPhillips. It’s something we long for while living in a region where we see so few others who look like us. https://t.co/qKwhe1Iomd

name: sfchronicle
text: As much as getting the coronavirus vaccine is a clinical medical procedure, it can also be a very emotional act, both for those who receive it and for their friends and family. https://t.co/9b4oeIyNE2
